intro: Calonema tentaculatum, commonly known as the tentacle calonema, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive, tubular flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of pink or red. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Calonema tentaculatum is popular among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
